Norwalk.Lockwood\u2013Mathews Mansion: The Lockwood–Mathews Mansion is a Second Empire style country house, now a museum, at 295 West Avenue in Norwalk, Connecticut. It was built in 1864-68 by railroad and banking magnate LeGrand Lockwood. The 62-room 44,000 square feet (4,100 m2) (26,402 square feet (2,452.8 m2) of living space) mansion was listed on the National Register of Historic Places and was declared a National Historic Landmark in 1978.
